intro: Korthalsia furtadoana, commonly known as the Furtado's korthalsia, is a rare and striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after species in botanical gardens and specialty collections. Due to habitat loss, it is also considered vulnerable, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
